definition[0]: a supply of something, especially a product or crop, that is more than is needed
example[0]: a glut of oil on the world market
definition[1]: to cause something to have too much of something
definition[2]: a supply of something that is more than is needed, caused by producing too much of it
example[2]: A world-wide glut of memory chips should prevent prices from rising.
example[3]: OPEC cut production in an effort to prevent anoil glut
definition[3]: to produce a supply of something that is more than is needed, causing its price to fall
example[4]: The market is already glutted with unsold properties.
